title: How 18 Minutes Changed History: Texas, Mexico, and the U.S. Takeover
description:
Texas, once part of Mexico, became a hotspot of conflict over land, slavery, and migration.
Anglo-American settlers rebelled, leading to the Texas Revolution of 1835.
The Battle of San Jacinto, lasting just 18 minutes, secured Texan independence.
In 1845, Texas was annexed by the U.S., straining ties with Mexico.

title: Where the Sea Foams: A Pearl Diver’s Journal from Korkai
category: Historical Fiction – Maritime & Cultural Heritage (Sangam Era, South India)
description:
Set in ancient Korkai during the Sangam era, this fictional journal follows Aravan, a pearl diver of the Parathavar community.
Blending history and storytelling, it explores maritime life, Roman trade, social hierarchies, and the harsh beauty of the sea.
Through Aravan’s eyes, we witness the daily struggles, rituals, and resilience of a coastal people shaped by the tides.
